intro: Microgonium henzariense, commonly known as the Henschke's microgonium, is a rare and delicate aquatic plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Hydrocharitaceae and is characterized by its small, branching stems and minute, ribbon-like leaves. The plant typically grows in shallow, still waters with soft, muddy substrates. Its flowers are inconspicuous, producing small, greenish-white blooms that are adapted for aquatic pollination. Due to habitat loss and environmental changes, Microgonium henzariense is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
